intro: Oenothera picensis subsp. cordobensis, commonly known as the Cordoba evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential horticultural value.
